key_points: Key West Wing aides are reportedly frustrated with Vice President Kamala Harris and her staff, feeling there is no time to address these issues amid other legislative and political concerns.
Harris and her circle are reportedly upset that she is not being adequately prepared or positioned, feeling sidelined instead.
There is speculation about Harris' future roles, whether running for presidency in 2024 or supporting Biden's potential re-election.
Insiders believe Harris is not being well-prepared for her role; she faces high scrutiny as the first woman and woman of color in her position.
Defenders of Harris are concerned about her public perception and lack of substantive work, some even fearing Biden might replace her.
Speculation grows among Democrats about Harris' position and potential primary challenges due to perceived weaknesses.
Harris has less Washington experience than President Biden, complicating her adjustment to the vice presidency.
Racism and sexism are seen as underlying issues affecting Harris' public perception and responsibilities.
Sources claim Harris' staff has often failed her, and her cautious approach and staff issues have been longstanding traits.
Despite efforts to integrate Harris into significant roles within the administration, there are concerns she is not fully utilized.
spokespersons: Eleni Kounalakis (Lieutenant Governor of California, Longtime friend of Kamala Harris)
Minyon Moore (Longtime Democratic operative, important outside adviser to Kamala Harris)
